creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
[22] (number of the pieces in the series)
Yasuhide\'s poem:
(Wind blown from the Mountain
Storming around the autumn field
That\'s why the word \"storm\" (arashi)
Consits of the characters of wind and mountain)
{Fuku kara ni
Aki no kusaki wo 
Shio ru reba
Mube yama-kaze wo 
Arashi to yū ran}
followed by a detailed explanation of the poem
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Illustrations of the Hundred Poems by the Hundred Poets (Hyakunin isshu no uchi)
title: Illustration of the Bunya no Yasuhide's Poem
